Package cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core

Interface Tree<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E -
    All Superinterfaces:
    Graph<E>, java.lang.Iterable<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTree, DefaultGeneralTree
    public interface Tree<E>
extends Graph<E>
    A tree is a data structure represented by a directed acyclic graph, imitating the shape of a tree.It is a set of connected nodes. A node is the basic unit over which the tree is constructed and may have zero or several children. A node A is parent of a node B if there is a direct connection from A to B. There can be only a single node without a parent and that is called root.

    This interface represents trees on its most wide definition.

    Author:
    Javier Marrero
    See Also:
    Graph

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the tree. The height of a tree is a recursive relation defined by the following formula:
        • 0 if the tree contains the root only
        • max(H(c1), H(c2), ..., H(cn) if the tree contains more nodes
        Returns:
        an integer representing the tree height
